result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley L Matthews

records.addlTxt:
JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated October 24, 2022; received and filed.
Legal - New Criminal Charges were filed resulting in Milwaukee County Case 22CF4104. 
Defendant IN CUSTODY.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.
Court ordered Defendant maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews in Court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared in Court for Wesley L Matthews.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing with Defendant's other Case, 21CF3806. Defendant has NEW CASE, 22CF4101. Discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard regarding bail. Court set CASH BAIL. Court addressed NO CONTACT ORDER. 
Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Wonda T., Beverly T. Quinesha M.

NO CONTACT/NO FIREARMS ORDER; signed, filed, and distributed. Defendant received a copy.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Wesley L Matthews.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Return on Warrant with Defendant's other Case, 21CF3806. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court that Defendant was in fact IN CUSTODY on October 13, 2022 (the day the warrant was issued). State confirmed with Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. Defendant was in MPD CUSTODY on October 13, 2022. WARRANT WAS ISSUED IN ERROR. Court REINSTATED ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT. 

For reasons stated on the record, case passed to 4:00pm.
Case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Branch 46.

Return on Warrant scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to MCSO, ADA Mathy, and Attorney Steve Sargent.
Bench Warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department on October 16, 2022.
NO CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews not in Court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in Court for Wesley L Matthews.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing with Defendant's other Case, 21CF3806. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed Defendant's case in Waukesha County. Defense is unsure of Defendant's whereabouts. Defense requested a Calendar Call date. State requested a Warrant. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's request. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further ordered that Bail is FORFEITED; however, Court STAYED Order of Forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 12, 2022; received and filed.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated September 19, 2022; received and filed.
Legal - New Criminal Charges were filed resulting in Waukesha County Case 22CF1468. 
Defendant IN CUSTODY.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Wesley L Matthews.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other case 21CF3806. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Status hearing to allow time to review Discovery on case 22CF2240. State did not object. Defense requested Bail/Bond Modification. For reasons stated on the record, Court DECLINED Defense's request. Defense advised the Court of possible Joinder Motion. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail Bond/Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Bail Bond/Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 9:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Wesley L Matthews.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3806. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Kasberger. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Mr Matthews is reminded to continue working with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 7, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews in court by audio with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent who appears in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Sargent is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Mr Matthews is advised that he will need to appear in person on the next date if he doesn't have video capability.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 22, 2022; received and filed.

-received and filed.
Attorney Stephen Sargent

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 5 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/08/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wesley L Matthews in Court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant has Case 21CF3806 pending in Branch 46. Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Case assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for Initial Appearance in OCCR. Attorney Sargent will appear with Defendant at the Initial Appearance. Initial Appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm in Room 221 of the Safety Building.
